repnme.cdata!:
Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia -
            Policy Based Guarantee Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Policy Based Guarantee
            (PBG) Project for Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was moderate; Bank performance was satisfactory and
            borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned includes: the PBG instrument proved to be a
            successful instrument for leveraging additional resources
            for the client. FYR Macedonia would have been unable to
            raise a loan of this size without the PBG. Due to its
            improved leverage of Bank assets, the PBG is a viable and
            potentially more powerful policy-based financing tool than a
            Development Policy Loan (DPL). The PBG has proven to be a
            useful instrument, in particular with the current incentive
            structure. The instrument might be of particular benefit to
            smaller countries, for which the leveraging ability of this
            instrument might be of higher importance than for bigger
            ones. The program permitted adequate flexibility to account
            for responses to changing circumstances, especially during
            times of crisis.

repnme.cdata!:
Macedonia, former Yugoslav Republic of -
            Policy Based Guarantee Project : summary of discussion

abstracts.cdata!:
The Executive Directors approved the
            policy based guarantee to the former Yugoslav Republic of
            Macedonia in the amount of EUR 100 million (USD 134.9
            million equivalent) on the terms and conditions set out in
            the President's Memorandum (R2011-0224). Directors
            expressed support for the Policy Based Guarantee, which will
            support reforms to enhance sustainability of public finances
            and functioning of the labor markets. They acknowledged that
            the policy based guarantee will assist the country in its
            efforts to access international capital markets, diversify
            its borrowing portfolio, and raise funds on more competitive
            terms. Directors noted that in spite of the growing
            uncertainty in the external economic environment, the
            Government has maintained strong macroeconomic management
            and structural reforms. They, however, noted with concern
            the country's slow economic growth and increasing
            finance needs.

repnme.cdata!:
Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia -
            Policy Based Guarantee Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Policy Based
            Guarantee (PBG) Program for Former Yugoslav Republic of
            Macedonia is to help reduce future risks to stability by
            strengthening sustainability of public finances and the
            resilience of the financial sector and to support improved
            protection of the most vulnerable and to enhance incentives
            for formal labor market participation. This program document
            describes the PBG to the Former Yugoslav Republic of
            Macedonia (FYR Macedonia) to support the government's
            program aimed at strengthening sustainability of public
            finances and functioning of labor markets, improving
            performance of social protection, and strengthening
            resilience of the financial sector. The medium-term fiscal
            policy supported by the program will remain supportive of
            macroeconomic stability, as well as nascent growth recovery.
            The program, among others, supports measures to enhance
            incentives for formal labor market participation. In
            addition, the program will continue to support social
            protection reforms to ensure that future growth is more
            inclusive than before, and financial sector stability,
            including by supporting an independent and accountable
            monetary authority and strengthening contingency planning.
            The PBG is proposed in light of the country's strong
            track record in macroeconomic management, improving
            structural and social policies and adequate external
            financing plan. FYR Macedonia restored macroeconomic
            stability early in the transition process and has maintained
            it for almost one and a half decades. This, combined with
            structural reforms, facilitated stronger growth prior to the
            crisis while keeping internal and external balances manageable.
